intro: Myosotis suavis, commonly known as sweet william, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, and it is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, blue-green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Myosotis suavis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
